Articles.Content:
Are you suffering from lag from high part count because of all those solar panels on your ion/electric plane?

Yes? Then fear no more!

This large set of wings has a huge solar panel on it generating up to 45 electric charge/second! (Not OP though because if you put static panels across the whole wing it would generate hundreds per second)

DOWNLOAD

Edited November 21, 2014 by JoePatrick1

It's about time someone made a part like this! +Rep and this goes in my permanent mods folder.

*edit* Are you planning to make B9-compatible modular wings as well?

#NinjaComment - haha thanks

Edited August 5, 2014 by JoePatrick1
I'm not a big planes guy myself but this certainly looks way better than having 68 individual pannels stuck on. Good job

Not quite sure what you mean by b9 compatible (as you can see in the pic - B9 is installed) but if by modular you mean like normal wings in KSP then yes - they will come fairly soon

- - - Updated - - -

I'm not a big planes guy myself but this certainly looks way better than having 68 individual pannels stuck on. Good job

Thanks - I also wasn't until I downloaded KAX (where the turboprops came from) and then as I run KSP on a pretty low-end laptop I needed something to get the power without killing my pc
Is that FAR-compatible?

Is that FAR-compatible?

I haven't done anything to make it so...I could probably do so though
Instructions are in the FAR wiki, link in OP
Yes! This is sooo needed on my laptop!

actually though if you're going to allow FAR use better break it down into smaller wing parts. Otherwise that angled section of the wing won't be modeled. FAR will just treat it as a straight wing (as I understand things). Smaller wing parts would be better anyways since it could allow people to use something like Infernal Robotics to fold up the wing to ship it off to Eve or Laythe - or maybe even Duna if the craft could be built light enough

I'm a noob. I just down loaded your mod. How do I install it? It doesn't seem to have a game data folder like the others. Where should I be copying it so I don't screw every thing up? Instructions?

Lee
just place this folder inside your gamedata folder in (go to the ksp folder, double click on the gamedata folder, then paste)

I'm a noob. I just down loaded your mod. How do I install it? It doesn't seem to have a game data folder like the others. Where should I be copying it so I don't screw every thing up? Instructions?

Lee

Yep, just copy this into the game data folder
i don't know how i missed this before. been waiting for something of the sort ever since i started building airplanes... thanks so much!

i don't know how i missed this before. been waiting for something of the sort ever since i started building airplanes... thanks so much!

You're more than welcome. Enjoy and spread the word
A +1 sword of Lag's Bane to you, good sir!

Fantastic! Provides plenty of juice at high noon.

However, I haven't tried to do much flying with this yet. Does it provide insane amounts of lift as the large size and high aspect ratio would lead me to believe?

Nope, the lift rating needs a serious overhaul. gonna tinker around and see what I can come up.

EDIT: Setting the line deflectionLiftCoeff = 48 has proven to be reasonable. It was 1.6 before, which is identical to the AV-R8 winglets.

Edited August 7, 2014 by MaverickSawyer
Excellent mod, and a free bump for you, good sir.
Great.. Can you do the stock wings as well?
Several months later, I have finally fixed the config. Sorry for leaving it so long when it was such a simple fix.
life check on this mod
This mod is ded.
